content:
Based on the web search results provided, it seems that "pls" is an abbreviation for the phrase "please" in English, which can be translated to "por favor" in Portuguese.

The most common use of "pls" is in requests, for example, "pls translate this" can be translated to "por favor, traduza isto" in Portuguese.

Google Translate is a service offered by Google, which can translate words, phrases, and web pages between English and over 100 other languages, including Portuguese, [[1](https://translate.google.com.br/)]. It can also be used to translate sentences and phrases like "pls say something" to "por favor, diga algo" or "pls to hear yours" to "por favor, para ouvir o seu" [[8](https://mymemory.translated.net/en/English/Portuguese/pls-say-something)] [[9](https://mymemory.translated.net/en/English/Portuguese/pls-to-hear-yours)].

Additionally, there are also other online tools available for translating from English to Portuguese like DocTranslator [[10](https://doctranslator.com/translate-english-to-portuguese/)], Linguee [[5](https://www.linguee.com/english-portuguese/translation/pls+pls.html)], Glosbe [[4](https://glosbe.com/en/pt/PLS)], and others, which can be used to translate a wide range of phrases, sentences, and texts.
